reference.title: New Android Virtual Device Instance dialog (main information)
reference.shortdesc: The second in a sequence of dialogs that are presented when you create a new AVD from the Device Management view, this dialog lets you specify various aspects of the AVD itself, such as which version of the operating system it runs and what the screen dimensions are.

strow.stentry: The system image the AVD is to use.

The screen resolution and orientation. For instance, "HVGA-L" causes the AVD to use an HVGA display (480x320 pixels) in landscape orientation. "QVGA-P" indicates a QVGA display (320x240 pixels) in portrait orientation.

Use this field if you want to specify a non-default location for the AVD directory that will be constructed for this virtual device. Leave Use default selected if the default location is acceptable. Otherwise, clear the Use default option and specify your desired directory location.

Allows you to specify whether the emulated device has an emulated SD card. To use an existing SD card image (a .img file), select Existing and then specify the path to the card image file. To create a new SD card, select New, enter a numeric value in the field that follows, and specify the units for that value (KB or MB).
Internal Emulator Window (not available on Mac OS X)

Controls whether the AVD is displayed within the Android Emulator view directly or using VNC. Normally you would leave Show the Native Emulator Window within an Eclipse View (Recommended) selected; only if the native option does not work correctly on your development machine should you select Use VNC to show the Emulator within an Eclipse View. Note that these options only control how the emulator image is displayed within the Android Emulator view, and not whether the image is displayed in a view or in an external window.
AVD timeout value. By default this is set to 60 seconds.

section.p: Click Finish to create the AVD with the default startup options, or click Next if you want to view and possibly alter the options that will be used when this AVD is started.
